reader
Class ReaderManager

java.lang.Object
  reader.ReaderManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<TabularDataReader>
public class ReaderManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<TabularDataReader>

Provides high-level access to the Triplifier's data reader plugin system. Includes methods for opening data files and getting instances of particular reader plugins. There should generally be few situations where you might need to manually instantiate plugin classes. Using the methods in ReaderManager is much simpler, less error-prone, and recommended whenever possible.

          Initializes a new ReaderManager.

Constructor Detail

ReaderManager

public ReaderManager()
Initializes a new ReaderManager. No plugins are loaded by default. The LoadReaders() method must be called to find and load reader plugins.

Method Detail

loadReaders

public void loadReaders()
                 throws java.io.IOException
Load all reader plugins. All compiled class files in the reader/plugins directory will be examined to see if they implement the TabularDataReader interface. If so, they will be loaded as valid reader plugins for use by the ReaderManager.

Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
java.io.IOException

getSupportedFormats

public java.lang.String[] getSupportedFormats()
Get all file formats supported by the loaded reader plugins. The returned strings contain short format identifiers that can be used to request specific readers from the getReader() method.

Returns:
An array of file format identifiers for all loaded plugins.

getReader

public TabularDataReader getReader(java.lang.String formatstring)
Get a reader for the specified input file format. The format string should correspond to the value returned by the getFormatString() method of the reader. If a reader matching the file format is found, a new instance of the reader is created and returned.

Parameters:
formatstring - The input file format.
Returns:
A new instance of the reader supporting the specified format.

iterator

public java.util.Iterator<TabularDataReader> iterator()
Returns an iterator for all reader plugins loaded by this ReaderManager. This should only be used for querying properties of the readers, and not for actually obtaining a reader to use for reading data. For that purpose, use either getReader() or one of the openFile() methods, since these actually return a new instance of the requested reader.

Specified by:
iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<TabularDataReader>
Returns:
An iterator for all loaded reader plugins.

openFile

public TabularDataReader openFile(java.lang.String filepath)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Attempts to open the specified file with an appropriate reader plugin. The testFile() method of the readers is used to find a reader that can open the file. If a reader for the file type is found, a new instance of the reader is created and returned after opening the file.

Parameters:
filepath - The path of the data file to open.
Returns:
A new instance of a reader if an appropriate reader is found that opens the file successfully. Otherwise, returns null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

openFile

public TabularDataReader openFile(java.lang.String filepath,
                                  java.lang.String formatstring)
Attempts to open a data file with a specified format. If a reader supporting the format is found, a new instance of the reader is created and returned after opening the file.

Parameters:
filepath - The path of the data file to open.
formatstring - The format of the input file.
Returns:
A new instance of a reader if a reader for the format is available and opens the file successfully. Otherwise, returns null.
